oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Souvenir Du Camp De La Courtine
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Composite of colorized photographic images showing a well developed French camp. Written on the reverse is "Map of France 1918" and "E. G. Hollowell." Pvt. Euliss Grant Hallowell (Hollowell) of Huntington, Carroll County, Tenn. served in HQ Co., 63rd Art. Brig., Coastal Art. Corps. The Coastal Artillery manned coastal defenses. Hallowell served at Ft. Pickens and Ft. Barrancas until being sent to France in September 1918. He farmed and ran a sorghum mill in Carroll County after the war.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
